dir-section.heading: Banking
dir-section.p: In 2021 there were 30 commercial banks operating in Poland.

org-entry.content-note: fmrly Bank Przemysłowo-Handlowy PBK SA; present name adopted in 2004

org-entry.ownership: 50.1% owned by Banco Comercial Português SA (Portugal)

org-entry.content-note: 52.4% owned by Polish National Fund for the Protection of the Environment and Water

org-entry.ownership: 20.0% owned by Powszechny Zakład Ubezpieczeń, 12.8% owned by Polski Fundusz Rozwoju

org-entry.content-note: finances agriculture, forestry and food processing
specializes in corporate and investment banking
fmrly Bank Handlowy w Warszawie (Trade Bank in Warsaw)
org-entry.ownership: 75% owned by Citibank Overseas Investment Corpn (USA)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: PKO Bank Polski—Powszechna Kasa Oszczędności Bank Państwowy—PKO

org-entry.content-note: present name adopted in 2013 after merger of Raiffeisen Bank Polska and Polbank EFG
org-entry.ownership: 100% owned by Raiffeisen International Bank Holding AG (Austria)

role-group.role: Pres. of Man. Bd and CEO

org-entry.content-note: insurance group comprising two principal cos dealing in life and non-life insurance, and six support cos

org-entry.ownership: wholly owned by NN Continental Europe Holdings BV (Netherlands)
98.6% owned by UNIQA internationale Beteiligungs-Verwaltungs GmbH

org-entry.content-note: marine, air, motor, fire, luggage and credit insurance
org-entry.ownership: 75.7% owned by Talanx International AG; 24.3% owned by Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Co
